trans-unit.source: description: Provides a value for any XAML attribute by evaluating a reference to a resource that comes from a custom resource-lookup implementation.
trans-unit.target: description: Provides a value for any XAML attribute by evaluating a reference to a resource that comes from a custom resource-lookup implementation.

trans-unit.source: Resource lookup is performed by a CustomXamlResourceLoader class implementation.
trans-unit.target: Resource lookup is performed by a CustomXamlResourceLoader class implementation.

trans-unit.source: title: {CustomResource} markup extension' ms.assetid: 3A59A8DE-E805-4F04-B9D9-A91E053F3642
trans-unit.target: title: {CustomResource} markup extension' ms.assetid: 3A59A8DE-E805-4F04-B9D9-A91E053F3642

trans-unit.source: {CustomResource} markup extension
trans-unit.target: {CustomResource} markup extension

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Provides a value for any XAML attribute by evaluating a reference to a resource that comes from a custom resource-lookup implementation.
trans-unit.target: Provides a value for any XAML attribute by evaluating a reference to a resource that comes from a custom resource-lookup implementation.

trans-unit.source: Resource lookup is performed by a [**CustomXamlResourceLoader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243327) class implementation.
trans-unit.target: Resource lookup is performed by a [**CustomXamlResourceLoader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243327) class implementation.

trans-unit.source: XAML attribute usage
trans-unit.target: XAML attribute usage

trans-unit.source: XAML values
trans-unit.target: XAML values

trans-unit.source: Term
trans-unit.target: Term

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: key
trans-unit.target: key

trans-unit.source: The key for the requested resource.
trans-unit.target: The key for the requested resource.

trans-unit.source: How the key is initially assigned is specific to the implementation of the [**CustomXamlResourceLoader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243327) class that is currently registered for use.
trans-unit.target: How the key is initially assigned is specific to the implementation of the [**CustomXamlResourceLoader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243327) class that is currently registered for use.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: **CustomResource** is a technique for obtaining values that are defined elsewhere in a custom resource repository.
trans-unit.target: **CustomResource** is a technique for obtaining values that are defined elsewhere in a custom resource repository.

trans-unit.source: This technique is relatively advanced and isn't used by most Windows Runtime app scenarios.
trans-unit.target: This technique is relatively advanced and isn't used by most Windows Runtime app scenarios.

trans-unit.source: How a **CustomResource** resolves to a resource dictionary is not described in this topic, because that can vary widely depending on how [**CustomXamlResourceLoader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243327) is implemented.
trans-unit.target: How a **CustomResource** resolves to a resource dictionary is not described in this topic, because that can vary widely depending on how [**CustomXamlResourceLoader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243327) is implemented.

trans-unit.source: The [**GetResource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243340) method of the [**CustomXamlResourceLoader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243327) implementation is called by the Windows Runtime XAML parser whenever it encounters a `{CustomResource}` usage in markup.
trans-unit.target: The [**GetResource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243340) method of the [**CustomXamlResourceLoader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243327) implementation is called by the Windows Runtime XAML parser whenever it encounters a `{CustomResource}` usage in markup.

trans-unit.source: The *resourceId* that is passed to **GetResource** comes from the *key* argument, and the other input parameters come from context, such as which property the usage is applied to.
trans-unit.target: The *resourceId* that is passed to **GetResource** comes from the *key* argument, and the other input parameters come from context, such as which property the usage is applied to.

trans-unit.source: A `{CustomResource}` usage doesn't work by default (the base implementation of [**GetResource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243340) is incomplete).
trans-unit.target: A `{CustomResource}` usage doesn't work by default (the base implementation of [**GetResource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243340) is incomplete).

trans-unit.source: To make a valid `{CustomResource}` reference, you must perform each of these steps:
trans-unit.target: To make a valid `{CustomResource}` reference, you must perform each of these steps:

trans-unit.source: Derive a custom class from [**CustomXamlResourceLoader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243327) and override [**GetResource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243340) method.
trans-unit.target: Derive a custom class from [**CustomXamlResourceLoader**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243327) and override [**GetResource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243340) method.

trans-unit.source: Do not call base in the implementation.
trans-unit.target: Do not call base in the implementation.

trans-unit.source: Set [**CustomXamlResourceLoader.Current**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243328) to reference your class in initialization logic.
trans-unit.target: Set [**CustomXamlResourceLoader.Current**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243328) to reference your class in initialization logic.

trans-unit.source: This must happen before any page-level XAML that includes the `{CustomResource}` extension usage is loaded.
trans-unit.target: This must happen before any page-level XAML that includes the `{CustomResource}` extension usage is loaded.

trans-unit.source: One place to set **CustomXamlResourceLoader.Current** is in the [**Application**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242324) subclass constructor that's generated for you in the App.xaml code-behind templates.
trans-unit.target: One place to set **CustomXamlResourceLoader.Current** is in the [**Application**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242324) subclass constructor that's generated for you in the App.xaml code-behind templates.

trans-unit.source: Now you can use `{CustomResource}` extensions in the XAML that your app loads as pages, or from within XAML resource dictionaries.
trans-unit.target: Now you can use `{CustomResource}` extensions in the XAML that your app loads as pages, or from within XAML resource dictionaries.

trans-unit.source: **CustomResource** is a markup extension.
trans-unit.target: **CustomResource** is a markup extension.

trans-unit.source: Markup extensions are typically implemented when there is a requirement to escape attribute values to be other than literal values or handler names, and the requirement is more global than just putting type converters on certain types or properties.
trans-unit.target: Markup extensions are typically implemented when there is a requirement to escape attribute values to be other than literal values or handler names, and the requirement is more global than just putting type converters on certain types or properties.

trans-unit.source: All markup extensions in XAML use the "\{" and "\}" characters in their attribute syntax, which is the convention by which a XAML processor recognizes that a markup extension must process the attribute.
trans-unit.target: All markup extensions in XAML use the "\{" and "\}" characters in their attribute syntax, which is the convention by which a XAML processor recognizes that a markup extension must process the attribute.

trans-unit.target: Related topics
